channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.description:
Outside basement flats risk of flooding if blocked

item.title: Litter & Flytip, 10th February
item.description:
There is a growing pile of various litter and small flytip at this location, just by an entrance to the rear of the High Street buildings.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars parked in goods vehicle loading bay, 10th February
item.description:
Every time I try to park to load/unload goods, I find these bays are taken by drivers parking their cars. I politely asked one driver sat in his Vauxhall when he was going to move so I could unload, he showed me his disabled badge and said he wasn’t moving. Loading bays are specifically for loading/unloading only.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, Brockley Rise, Honor Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Small drain leak on road, 10th February
item.description:
Drain leak on Buckingham Palace Road in yellow box junction leading into Victoria Bus Station/ Terminus Place. Been leaking since 0200hrs on 10/02/2026. Just a trickle of water moving down into Bus Station
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Terminus Place, Victoria, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road drain directly outside the doors of The Horse Hospital, Collonade, W1CN 1JD, 10th February
item.description:
Drain floods the road whenever there is rainfall and takes a long time to drain, please can this be cleared as the building is dealing with damp issues
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colonnade, Bloomsbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pole 16 and pole 17 are covered with foliage. Local council need to be informed asap. Follow up visit required, 10th February
item.description:
Pole 16 and pole 17 are covered with foliage. Local council need to be informed asap. Follow up visit required
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hertford Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Number 37 Plumstead common road., 10th February
item.description:
Residential wheelie bins left on the pavement AT ALL TIMES, constantly overflowing and not one of them is for recycling. Local GP Surgery just feet away. People struggle to walk past with kids or the elderly as most of the pavement is blocked by rubbish and there is only space for one person to walk through. The wheelie bins have a proper spot by the side of the building (Herbert Place SE18 ) not the front of it on Plumstead Common Road. Please and thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Plumstead Common Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household rubbish dumped., 10th February
item.description:
Known residents of Wickham lane dumping rubbish on Bastion Road. Attracting vermin. Please can this be cleared as a priority. I am so frustrated. Every day it’s something new dumped.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bastion Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Bed Base dumped by post box, 10th February
item.description:
There is a large brown bed base on Wickham Lane near the post box. It was laying flat and blocking the pavement at one point.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wickham Lane, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish along the whole grass verge, 10th February
item.description:
I did report this under ref 8514492, which included a report about scattered papers. From the junction where Alsike meets Rushdene heading towards Maran Way and further, there is a build up of rubbish along the whole stretch of the grass verge along the railway track. It's a constant problem and needs regular monitoring. I can only send two pics, but I'd need to send about fifteen

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alsike Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Both bollards, central island lamppost and street lamp post not working., 10th February
item.description:
All lights out for two weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, St Paul's Wood Hill, St Paul's Cray, Greater London

item.title: Waverley crescent, 10th February
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Heavitree Close, Plumstead

item.title: Old mill road, 10th February
item.description:
Blocked street gullies : Opposite the Bus stand on Old mill road All along the Old mill road / Waverley Crescent / Plumstead common road / Warwick terrace. Every other gully is blocked by leaves mud and rubbish in the whole Plumstead common area.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Plumstead Common Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish at bus stop in bushes and on grass verge, 10th February
item.description:
Repeatedly having to report build up of rubbish which has been there for a couple of months at this bus stop. The contractors are not doing what the council pays them for. Rubbish gathers in bushes and behind barriers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alsike Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Warwick terrace and Waverley Crescent junction, 10th February
item.description:
Blocked gully. There are a few more around the whole green space area ( Plumstead common).

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Warwick Terrace, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 9 Merton Rise, 10th February
item.description:
As you see from the current winter photo, this tree has not been trimmed back to its pruning points but other trees in the immediate area have been and I believe this must have been missed. As a result the tree has grown excessively. The pavement is also lifting. I think it needs pruning to keep it in order and to avoid hazards. (It also causes light restrictions to a couple of properties though I understand this is not a council issue)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Merton Rise, Belsize Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: General rubbish, black bags split open, 10th February
item.description:
Contents of split black bags of rubbish on grass verge, health hazard and will attract rats. The rubbish is hidden behind a bush, so not obvious fron roadside

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alsike Road, West Heath, Greater London
